unit.name: Tomb King
unit.description: Magic: A Tomb King is a Level 1 wizard. Equipment: Tomb Blade and light armour. Special Rules: My Will Be Done, Tomb Kings Curse.

unit.name: Lich High Priest
unit.description: Magic: A Lich High Priest is a Level 4 wizard. Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: none.

unit.name: Necrotect
unit.description: Equipment: Additional hand weapons and light armour.. Special Rules: No Leader, Necrotect.

unit.name: Tomb Herald (BSB)
unit.description: Equipment: Tomb Blade and light armour. Special Rules: BSB.

unit.name: Tomb Prince
unit.description: Magic: A Tomb Prince is not a wizard. Equipment: Tomb Blade and light armour. Special Rules: My Will Be Done, Tomb Kings Curse.

unit.name: Lich Priest
unit.description: Magic: A Lich Priest is a Level 2 wizard. Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: none.

unit.name: Skeleton Warrior
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon, light armour and shield. Special Rules: Shambling, Block (shield).

unit.name: Skeleton Spearman
unit.description: Equipment: Spear, light armour and shield. Special Rules: Shambling, Anti-Cav(spear).

unit.name: Skeleton Archer
unit.description: Equipment: Bow. Special Rules: Shambling, Arrows of the Asp.

unit.name: Skeleton Horseman
unit.description: Mount: Skeletal Steed. Equipment: Spear and light armour (or shield). Special Rules: Light Cavalry, Shambling.

unit.name: Skeleton Horse Archer
unit.description: Mount: Skeletal Steed. Special Rules: Light Cavalry, Shambling, Arrows of the Asp.

unit.name: Skeleton Chariot
unit.description: Chariot: 5+AS, 1 Skeleton Driver, 1 Skeleton Crew, 2 Skeletal Steeds. Equipment: The Skeleton Crew/Champion is armed with spear and bow, the Skeleton Driver is armed with a hand weapon. Special Rules: Shambling, Light Chariot, Impact Hits (D3), Arrows of the Asp.

unit.name: Tomb Guard
unit.description: Equipment: Tomb Blade, light armour and shield. Special Rules: Shambling, Block (shield), Block (halberd).

unit.name: Ushabti
unit.description: Equipment: Great weapon. Special Rules: Animated Construct.

unit.name: Ushabti Archers
unit.description: Equipment: Great Bow. Special Rules: Animated Construct, Arrows of the Asp.

unit.name: Tomb Scorpion
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Animated Construct, Scaly Skin (5+), Killing Blow, MR (1), Entombed beneath the Sands, Poisoned Attacks (1), March Blocker.

unit.name: Tomb Swarm
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Skirmish, Small, Entombed beneath the Sands.

unit.name: Necropolis Knight
unit.description: Mount: Necroserpent. Equipment: Spear, heavy armour and shield. Special Rules: Shambling, Ambush, Poisoned Attacks (2) (Necroserpent only).

unit.name: Sepulchral Stalker
unit.description: Equipment: Halberd and heavy armour. Special Rules: Animated Construct, Ambush, Transmogryfying Gaze.

unit.name: Carrion
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Flying Skirmishers.

unit.name: Screaming Skull Catapult
unit.description: Warmachine: 3 Catapult Crew. Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Screaming Skull Catapult.

unit.name: Necrolith Colossus
unit.description: Equipment: Heavy Armour. Special Rules: Terror, Large Target, Scaly Skin (5+), Animated Construct.

unit.name: Casket of Souls
unit.description: Warmachine: 3 Casket Crew. Equipment: Great weapon and light armour. Special Rules: Casket of Souls.

unit.name: Khemrian Warsphinx
unit.description: Monster: 1 Khemrian Warsphinx and 4 Warsphinx Crew. Equipment: The crew is armed with spears. Special Rules: Terror, Large Target, Impact Hits (D3+1), Scaly Skin (3+), Animated Construct, Howdah.

unit.name: Necrosphinx
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Flying Model, Terror, Large Target, Scaly Skin (3+), Animated Construct, Poisoned Attacks (1), Killing Blow.

mount.name: Skeletal Steed
mount.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Shambling.

mount.name: Royal Chariot
mount.description: Chariot: 2 Skeletal Steeds. Special Rules: Light Chariot, Impact Hits (D3), Shambling.

mount.name: Dread Abyssal
mount.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Flying Model, Large Target, Terror, Animated Construct.

mount.name: Khemrian Warsphinx
mount.description: Monster: 1 Khemrian Warsphinx and 4 Warsphinx Crew. Equipment: The crew is armed with spears. Special Rules: Terror, Large Target, Impact Hits (D3+1), Scaly Skin (3+), Animated Construct, Howdah.

mount.name: Khemrian Warsphinx (Fiery Breath)
mount.description: Monster: 1 Khemrian Warsphinx and 4 Warsphinx Crew. Equipment: The crew is armed with spears. Special Rules: Terror, Large Target, Impact Hits (D3+1), Scaly Skin (3+), Animated Construct, Howdah, Fiery Breath.

item.name: Ambush
item.description: This unit may start the game in reserve. Beginning with turn 2, roll a d6 at the start of your turn: on a 4+ the unit may enter the battlefield from any board edge (as if it has left the board in a previous turn due to a pursuit), add +1 to the roll for each turn after the second, a natural 1 always fails.

item.name: Amulet of Pha-sta
item.description: Talismans, Enchanted Items and Arcane Items of enemy models stop working as long as they are in btb with the bearer. The bearer itself may not take any other magic items.

item.name: Animated Construct
item.description: - Cannot march. - The unit suffers one less wound from Crumbling (stacks with BSB).

item.name: Armour of Eternity
item.description: Light Armour. Enemies have to reroll successful to-wound rolls.

item.name: Armour of the Ages
item.description: Heavy Armour. Bearer gains +1T.

item.name: Arrows of the Asp
item.description: The model always hits at 5+ (independent of any modifiers) when it makes a ranged attack with any kind of bow.

item.name: BM I. o. Desiccation
item.description: (10+) Hex, Range 18", target unit suffers -1T and -1S until the start of the casters next magic phase.

item.name: BM I. o. Execution
item.description: (5+) One enemy unit in btb with the caster suffers D6 S4 hits

item.name: BM I. o. Immortal Loyalty
item.description: (12+) Create a new unit of Skeleton Warriors consisting of 2D6+3 rank and file models completely within 12" of the caster and no closer than 1" to enemy units. The front rank of the unit has to consist of exactly 5 models. This unit is worth 100 Victory Points.

item.name: BM I. o. Vengeance
item.description: (5+) MM, Range 24", D6 S4 hits

item.name: BSB
item.description: Units within 12" of the BSB lose one less wound from Crumbling

item.name: Banner of the Hidden Dead
item.description: If the units US is equal to or less than 15, the unit gets the Entombed beneath the Sands special rule and may start the game in reserve.

item.name: Banner of the Undy. Legion
item.description: PM 2/6+, Incantation of Summoning spell, can only be cast at the bearers unit.

item.name: Blade of Setep
item.description: Ignores armour saves. In addition any model hit by this weapon loses its magic armour, i.e. it is destroyed.

item.name: Blue Khepra
item.description: MR (2)

item.name: Bone Giant Blades
item.description: +1S. In addition during the turn the model charged, it gains 1 additional attack for each successful to-wound roll of its initial attacks.

item.name: Brooch of the Great Desert
item.description: Can be used at the start of any phase (of any player). The bearer and its unit cannot be targeted by spells or ranged attacks until the start of the Tomb Kings next turn. One use only.

item.name: Casket of Souls
item.description: Ranged attack that can be used in the shooting phase if the model did not move. Pick a unit within LOS then roll 2D6+2 and subtract the Ld of the target. Use the Ld value the unit would use for psychology tests (i.e. the highest of the unit, incl. modifiers, inspiring presence, etc.). The difference is the number of S5 no AS hits the unit takes (a negative result fails to do any hits). Hits count as magical.

item.name: Chariot of Fire
item.description: If the bearer rides a chariot, it inflicts Impact Hits (D3+2) instead of D3 that count as magical attacks.

item.name: Cloak of Dunes
item.description: The bearer can Fly. Models on foot only.

item.name: Collar of Shapesh
item.description: Each unsaved wound this model suffers may be transferred on a 4+ to a friendly unit within 3" of the bearer. No saves (of any kind, no Regeneration) for the recipients allowed. Wounds still count for combat resolution.

item.name: Crook and Flail of Radiance
Crook & Flail of Radiance
item.description: Count as additional hand weapons and grants ASF.

item.name: Crown of Kings
item.description: Can be used at the start of any magic phase. All successfully cast spells by this model in this magic phase count as cast with irresistible force. One use only.

item.name: Death Mask of Kharnut
item.description: Bearer causes Terror.

item.name: Destroyer of Eternities
item.description: Great weapon. Killing Blow. Instead of attacking normally the bearer may inflict 1 automatic hit to all models in btb. In a challenge only the model fighting in the challenge is hit (once). Models on foot only.

item.name: Dispel Scroll
item.description: Automatically dispels one spell without the need of DD. One use only.

item.name: Enchanted Shield
item.description: Shield that grants +2 AS

item.name: Enkhils Kanopi
item.description: Can be used at the start of any phase (of any player). All spell effects and RIP spells (by any player) are dispelled, i.e. they end immediately. One use only.

item.name: Entombed beneath the Sands
item.description:
This unit can opt to not setup during deployment and be held in reserve. If it does so, place a (unit specific) tomb marker (25mm diameter) for it anywhere on the board after deployment but before the starting player is determined. At the start of your second turn, roll a D6: if you roll a 4+ the unit shows up in the remaining movement phase. If it does not show up, roll at the start of each of your following turns and add +1 to the roll for each turn after the second. A natural ‘1’ always fails, i.e. the unit does not show up.
When the unit shows up, roll the Scatter and Artillery Dice. Scatter the tomb marker the distance rolled by the Artillery Dice in the direction indicated by the Scatter Dice. If the tomb marker scattered of the board the unit counts as destroyed. If the Scatter Dice shows a hit symbol, don’t move the tomb marker at all. If the Artillery Dice shows a misfire, the unit does not scatter but loses D3 wounds (with no saves allowed).
If the marker does not contact a unit, place the entombed unit completely within 3” of the marker. Models that cannot be placed without getting in contact with the board edge, impassable terrain or within 1” of an enemy unit are destroyed.
If the marker ends up at least partially under an enemy unit, the entombed unit is placed in BTB with the enemy unit and counts as in close combat but not as charging, i.e. fight in initiative order. The enemy unit cannot declare any charge responses and has to hold. The entombed unit is positioned on the side of the enemy unit where the highest number of models of the entombed unit can be legally placed. If there are multiple such sides, place the entombed unit on the side nearest to the marker (randomise if necessary). The entombed unit is placed as close to the marker as possible in a formation which faces the enemy unit and maximises the number of attacking models. If there is no space to legally place all models, every model that cannot be placed on the board is destroyed. If the marker ends up at least partially under a friendly unit, the entombed unit is placed exactly like in the case with an enemy unit but the units are not engaged in close combat.
If the unit appears and is not engaged in cc, it may still move (but not charge).

item.name: Fiery Breath (special rule)
Fiery Breath
item.description: Breath weapon, S3

item.name: Flail of Skulls
item.description: Flail. Each wound inflicted (after saves) causes 2 wounds.

item.name: Golden Ankhra
item.description: Ward Save (4+)

item.name: Golden Eye of Rah-nut
item.description: Ward Save (5+)

item.name: Great Bow
item.description: Range 30", S6

item.name: Hieratic Jar
item.description: The bearer may try to cast one of his PM spells a second time. One use only.

item.name: Hierophant
item.description: The army has to include a Hierophant. At the start of the game declare any one Liche (High) Priest with the highest Ld to be the Hierophant (i.e. the army has to include at least one Liche (High) Priest). At the end of the phase the Hierophant of the Tomb Kings army is killed (after possible regeneration saves, i.e. when the model is removed from play) make a Ldtest for each unit in the army. Each unit loses a number of wounds equal to the amount their respective test was failed by. There are no saves of any kind allowed vs wounds suffered in this way. Characters automatically pass this test and never suffer wounds in this way.

item.name: Howdah
item.description: If this model is used as a mount for a character, the character gets +1AS or a 4+ armour save which cannot be improved. Further, ranged attacks only hit the character on a 6 (instead of 5-6) when ranged hits are randomised between the mount and the character.

item.name: I. o. Cursed Blades PM 3/5+
I. o. Cursed Blades PM 2/5+
item.description: Augment, Range 18", target unit gets KB in cc. If the unit already has KB then the KB is improved to work on a 5+. Lasts until the casters next magic phase.

item.name: I. o. Protection PM 3/6+
I. o. Protection PM 2/6+
item.description: Augment, Range 18", unit gets a Ward Save (5+) until the casters next magic phase. Has no effect on character models.

item.name: I. o. Right. Smiting PM 3/5+
I. o. Right. Smiting PM 2/5+
item.description: Augment, Range 18", target unit with the Shambling special rule that is not in cc may immediately shoot once with any kind of bow it is equipped with. Each unit may only benefit from this spell once per magic phase.

item.name: I. o. Summoning PM 3/6+
I. o. Summoning PM 2/6 +
I. o. Summoning PM 2/6+
item.description: Augment, Range 18", targets one unit - Raise - 1D6: Skeleton infantry - 1D3: Skeleton cavalry, Tomb Guard - 1: all other single-wound models - Multi-wound models regain (heal) 1W but no additional models can be created Only rank and file models can be raised, i.e. no command group models. Raised models are equipped like the rest of the target unit. If the target unit comprises 5 or more models, raised models are placed in the back of the unit. In this way the ranks of a unit can be increased but not the number of files. If the unit comprises less than 5 models, raised models have to be used to create a rank of 5 models (inlc. character models) first (if possible). Additional models are then used to create additional ranks. Models that cannot be placed because of impassable terrain or enemy units within 1" are lost. Enemy units that are in BTB with the target unit are ignored for this purpose but models can only be placed if there is enough space, i.e. units are not moved to make space. - Has no effect on character models. - May increase unit above starting unit size but not above max unit size (see unit entry). - This spell cannot be lost through a miscast. - Models raised by this spell are not worth any extra VP. Use the original unit size to determine VP.

item.name: I. o. Urgency PM 3/5+
I. o. Urgency PM 2/5+
item.description: Augment, Range 18". Can only be cast on units with the Shambling trait (but may include character models without the Shambling trait). The unit may move up to 8" but may not charge. Each unit may only benefit from this spell once per magic phase.

item.name: Icon of Rakaph
item.description: If the unit only consists of models of Type Inf and is not engaged in cc, it may make a free reform at the start of the Tomb Kings movement phase before charges are declared. This reform does not prohibit the unit from shooting or moving/charging.

item.name: Icon of Rulership
item.description: If the bearer rides a chariot, the model gets US 6 but may still benefit from Ranged attacks at characters within or near units as if it had US 3.

item.name: Icon of the Sacred Eye
item.description: In each first round of combat the unit (inlc. mounts) gets +1 to to-hit rolls. Has no effect on character models.

item.name: Light Bolt Thrower
item.description: Range 36", S5, penetrates ranks, no Stand & Shoot, Large Targets suffer 2 wounds

item.name: Light Chariot
item.description: - Counts as a unit of chariots with all respective special rules, i.e. cannot march (even if Shambling and the general is within 12"), can be damaged by terrain etc. - The unit moves and fights like Light Cavalry - If a character rides a Light Chariot it works like a barded cavalry mount (i.e. it grants +2AS and the model has a combined profile) with US3 but the model still counts as a chariot for all other purposes. A character riding a Light Chariot can only join units with the Light Chariot special rule.

item.name: Mirage Standard
item.description: Ward Save (5+) vs shooting and magic missiles.

item.name: My Will Be Done
item.description: Infantry units (i.e. Skeletons and Tomb Guard) that are joined by this character fight with its WS as long as it is with the unit.

item.name: Necrotect
item.description: - This model and any unit with the Shambling special rule joined by this model hate all enemy models. - Units with the Animated Construct special rule within 12" gain Regeneration (6+).

item.name: Neferras Plaques of Mighty Incantations
Neferras Plaques of M. I.
item.description: Once per magic phase the bearer may reroll all(!) dice used to cast a spell (BM and PM). Can be used even if first roll was successful or a miscast. A reroll can cause irresistible force.

item.name: No Leader
item.description: This model may never be the army general. (Also units cannot use this models Ld for Ld-tests and this model does not allow a unit to rally below 25%.)

item.name: Power Stone
item.description: +2PD to cast a spell. Dice used may exceed maximum allowed by level. One use only.

item.name: Scorpion Armour
item.description: Heavy Armour. Regeneration (5+). In addition the bearer may ignore wounds suffered from Crumbling on a 4+ (roll for each wound separately).

item.name: Screaming Skull Catapult
item.description: Catapult, Range 12”-60”, 3” Template, S4(8), no AS, D3 wounds, magical attacks. Units that suffer one or more casualties must pass a panic test

item.name: Serpent Staff
item.description: +1A, Poisoned Attacks (3)

item.name: Shambling
item.description: Unit may not march, unless within 12" of the general at the start of the movement phase. Units can still be march blocked.

item.name: Shield of Ptra
item.description: Shield. At the start of the opponents shooting phase the bearer may target a unit in its LOS. If the target unit is within 24", it suffers -1 to to-hit rolls until the end of the phase.

item.name: Spear of Antahark
item.description: Spear. Each unsaved wound inflicted by this weapon restores one wound to a unit within 3" of the bearer (TK players choice). Wounds restored in this way work exactly like the Incantation of Summoning spell, i.e. multi-wound models can only regain wounds and no new models can be created, single-wound models can be raised and are equipped like the rest of the unit and so on. If the bearer tries to heal itself, roll a D6 for each wound used in this way. On a roll of a 4+ the bearer regains a wound (up to starting wounds). In each combat round only a single unit may restore wounds through this effect. Wounds are restored immediately

item.name: Staff of Mastery
item.description: +1 to cast spells (PM/BM)

item.name: Staff of Ravening
item.description: PM 2/7+, MM, Range 18", D6 S3 hits

item.name: Staff of Sorcery
item.description: +1 to total roll to attempt to dispel a spell.

item.name: Standard o. t. Cursing Word
item.description: At the start of each own magic phase, enemy models in btb with the bearer must pass a Ld test or suffer a wound with no AS.

item.name: Standard of the Sands
item.description: Can be used at the start of any of your opponents turns. In this turn units are not allowed to march (even Dwarfs) and all units suffer -1 to their rally tests. One use only.

item.name: Talisman of Protection
item.description: Ward Save (6+)

item.name: The Blade of Mourning
item.description: If a unit takes a wound from this weapon, the bearer and his units count as outnumbering for the purpose of combat resolution bonus for this combat in this phase.

item.name: Tomb Blade
item.description: Killing Blow, magical attacks

item.name: Tomb Kings Curse
item.description: The unit/model that kills this model, has to pass a Ld test or suffers D3 magical hits with a S equal to the base S of the killed model.

item.name: Transmogryfying Gaze
item.description: Ranged attack that can be used in the shooting phase. Range 12", S3, no AS, Multiple Shots (3), for to-wound rolls use targets I value instead of its T value, no penalty for moving and shooting.

item.name: Undead
item.description: - Immune to Psychology - Crumbling: When an undead unit loses combat it suffers a number of wounds equal to the break test modifier, there is no break test, i.e. undead units never break from combat. Character models in units are only affected if the unit is destroyed and there are unallocated wounds left. In this case wounds are distributed evenly between the character models (randomise odd wounds). There are no saves of any kind allowed vs wounds suffered in this way. - Cause Fear - Undead must choose Hold as charge response, i.e. they may not Stand and Shoot

item.name: Vambraces of the Sun
item.description: Model in btb loses 1A. The bearer may choose which model and which attack.

item.name: War Banner
item.description: +1CR
